If A (shirt is cotton), then B (pants are denim)

This does not imply that if not A (shirt is not cotton), then not B (pants are not denim). The correct logical structure for the latter statement would be:

If A (shirt is cotton), then B (pants are denim)
If not A (shirt is not cotton), then not B (pants are not denim)
